definition[0]: to start living in a new home
example[1]: Mom and Dad had always planned to move into a smaller house when we grew up.
definition[1]: to start living with someone in the same home
example[2]: Steveâ€™s going to move in with her.
definition[2]: to start being involved in and controlling a situation that someone else controlled previously
example[3]: The big multinationals moved in and started pushing up prices.
example[4]: Investors moved in on a group of car enthusiasts and took over the market.
definition[3]: to go towards a place or group of people, in order to attack them or take control of them
example[5]: Police moved in on the demonstrators in the square.
